page.title: 07WILD BIRDS
page.content: Birds in Dorset are mostly garden birds but the woods are filled with gamebirds and crows.Crows and hawks are a threat to farming as they eat seeds and take lambs,a kestrel is the farmers ally because it kills mice,shrews and rats that infest corn supplies and other stacks of food.Gamebirds are shot for meat,sport and sometimes to protect the crops like beans,peas etc.for pheasants and partridge eat corn,wheat etc.Crows are shot for ruining seeded fields.Although big hawks take sheep there is a law against shooting them and as with the deer there can be a heavy fine if a dead bird of prey is found on your land.Kestrels and owls kill vermin and other pests,barn owls nest in high rafters of barns while tawny+little owls spend the day on telephone wires and the night hunting.
